etymology.description: Pictogram: a jade artifact with carved patterns; later borrowed as a country name and 口 was added as a distinguishing mark; top later resembled 用.
etymology.interpretation: Depicts an ornamented jade piece, suggesting patterned, complete surfaces. When repurposed for the Zhou state/name, scribes appended 口 as a marker; later evolution made the top resemble 用, which encouraged the folk parsing as 口 + 用.

examples.chinese: 我们下周见(我們下週見)。
圆的周长很大(圓的周長很大)。
他环顾四周(他環顧四周)。
examples.english: He looked around in all directions.
